channel.title: BUbuisnessAndMarket
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from BUbuisnessAndMarket, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Jamie Dimon thinks India will be the new China as U.S. aims to diversify away from possible future adversary
item.description: "People call it the China+1 strategy. Companies that solely relied on China are looking at India, Vietnam, Malaysia, Indonesia etc."

item.title: Novo Nordisk CEO to testify at Senate hearing over high weight loss drug prices
item.description: Sen. Bernie Sanders argues that Novo Nordisk charges Americans substantially higher prices for its drugs than it does for patients in other countries.

item.title: Jill Biden announces $500 million government plan focusing on women’s health at Clinton Global Initiative
item.description: The spending will mainly come from the Department of Defense, which provides medical care to more than 230,000 active duty military women and nearly 2...

item.title: Microsoft's GitHub gives clients option to keep sensitive code in EU only, in data sovereignty push
item.description: GitHub is giving enterprise users the ability to store their sensitive code on only EU servers, hoping to meet the bloc's strict approach to data regu...

item.title: California Gov. Newsom signs law requiring schools districts to limit or ban students from using smartphones on campus
item.description: The move comes after Newsom signed a law in 2019 authorizing school districts to restrict student phone access.

item.title: Fed's jumbo interest rate cut puts the U.S. on track for a soft landing, Goldman CFO says
item.description: The Fed's move to lower interest rates by 50 basis points puts the U.S. economy on track for a soft landing, according to Goldman's chief financial of...

item.title: Boeing union says planemaker’s ‘final offer’ of a 30% raise for striking workers is not good enough
item.description: The union complained that Boeing publicized its latest offer to 33,000 striking workers without first bargaining with union negotiators.

item.title: Commerzbank board member warns of significant job losses with a hostile UniCredit takeover
item.description: Commerzbank supervisory board member Stefan Wittmann told CNBC's Annette Weisbach that "we certainly hope we can avoid" a hostile takeover by the Ital...

item.title: Stocks rise as China announces economic stimulus package
item.description: Chinese stocks rose sharply in trading today as the Central Bank of the Republic of China unveiled a wide-ranging package of stimulus initiatives mean...

item.title: Tuesday's analyst calls: Salesforce to pop more than 20%, Lowe's gets an upgrade
item.description: A software giant and a home improvement retailer were among the stocks being talked about by analysts on Tuesday.
